turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Full-service community schools in the United States.
turn.1: What are the differences between Full-service community schools and other schools?
turn.2: Among the many educational reform efforts, such as charter schools, school vouchers, magnet schools, and alternative schools, the full-service community school model is one of many educational reform efforts that are intended to increase student achievement, but the full-service community school model specifically focuses on the development of the community as a whole.
turn.3: Are charter schools considered a type of public school?
turn.4: A charter school receives public funds but is not subject to all of the rules, regulations, and statutes public schools must adhere to.
turn.5: What is the accountability of the school?
turn.6: A charter school is accountable to what is sent forth in its individual charter.
turn.8: A school voucher is a certificate issued by the government to allow families to apply it the cover the tuition at a private school.
turn.10: A magnet school is a public school with specialized courses and curricula.
turn.11: What is the purpose of an alternative school?
turn.12: An alternative school is a school that serves students who are at risk of not achieving academically or are better served by a non-traditional program.
